title: Rethinking SEO in the age of AI | Eli Schwartz (SEO advisor, author)
key_insights: AI Overviews will eliminate top-funnel SEO opportunities, but mid-funnel searches remain valuable for conversions
SEO should be treated as a product decision by PMs, not just a marketing tactic
Most B2B SaaS companies shouldn't prioritize SEO due to complex sales cycles and limited online conversion potential
Programmatic SEO works when there's scale and genuine user demand for the combinations being created
Focus on user intent and journey rather than rankings and traffic as success metrics
Link building should be brand building - getting genuine mentions rather than buying guest posts
Google's dominance is protected by distribution agreements and user habits, not just search quality
Keyword research tools can be off by 10x in either direction - use top-down TAM forecasting instead
topics_discussed: AI Overviews impact on search results
Google's market dominance and DOJ antitrust case
When B2B SaaS should avoid SEO
memorable_quotes: Think of SEO as a product. The product managers are the people that should be thinking about this SEO question because it's a product question.
If you can't answer the question about what is it that someone's going to do a search on, then don't do SEO.
SEO is not dying. There will always be a world where users are requesting their own information.
recommended_for: Growth professionals adapting to AI changes
SEO practitioners looking to modernize approach
summary: Eli Schwartz explains how AI is fundamentally changing SEO by eliminating top-funnel opportunities while preserving mid-funnel conversion potential. He advocates for treating SEO as a product decision focused on user journey optimization rather than traditional keyword-focused tactics, with specific guidance on when companies should and shouldn't invest in SEO.
